decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures through various means like Satyr Wayfinder and Collected Company, then using Rally the Ancestors to bring them all back at once. Nantuko Husk and other sacrifice effects are used to gain value from creatures entering and leaving the battlefield, while cards like Grim Haruspex and Liliana, Heretical Healer provide card advantage. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures and powerful synergies, creating a strong board presence and potentially winning the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing heroic creatures in an Azorius color combination. By playing low-cost creatures such as Seeker of the Way and Favored Hoplite, the deck aims to trigger heroic abilities multiple times with spells like Defiant Strike and Gods Willing. This synergy allows the deck to quickly grow its creatures and overwhelm opponents early on, while also having protection spells like Ajani's Presence and Valorous Stance to ensure its creatures stay on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of removal and disruption to control the board while steadily building up a strong creature presence. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells. The powerful lineup of creatures like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix is complemented by Planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion for additional threats. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress allows the deck to disrupt the opponent's plans, while cards like Abzan Charm provide versatility in dealing with different situations.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast-paced, aggressive strategy by using cards that trigger heroic abilities and pump up creatures. By utilizing cards like Ordeal of Thassa, Defiant Strike, and Gods Willing, you can quickly grow your creatures and protect them from removal spells. This deck focuses on pushing damage through with efficient creatures like Hero of Iroas and Seeker of the Way, supported by spells like Dromoka's Command and Ajani's Presence. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of buffed-up creatures and win the game before they can stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to create a strong and aggressive board presence while utilizing enchantments for card advantage and synergy. The deck focuses on playing enchantment creatures and enchantments like Sigil of the Empty Throne and Starfield of Nyx to generate additional threats and value. Cards like Kruphix's Insight and Eidolon of Blossoms help draw additional cards, while Doomwake Giant provides board control. The deck also includes a mix of mana acceleration and fixing with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and lands like Sandsteppe Citadel and Windswept Heath.

This deck focuses on using mana ramp through Elvish Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Rattleclaw Mystic to quickly play high-powered creatures such as Thunderbreak Regent, Dragonlord Atarka, and Atarka, World Render. The spells in the deck, like Crater's Claws and Draconic Roar, provide removal and direct damage to control the board. Xenagos, the Reveler and Xenagos, God of Revels provide additional mana and pump up creatures for extra damage. See the Unwritten acts as a powerful card advantage engine, allowing the player to quickly put threats on the board and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Hordeling Outburst and Monastery Swiftspear provide early pressure, while powerful spells like Stoke the Flames and Lightning Strike offer additional reach to finish off opponents. The deck's key strategy is to maintain tempo and apply constant pressure to force opponents into a defensive position.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Dissolve to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with Hero's Downfall and Languish to deal with threats on the board, the deck aims to establish a dominant position and outvalue the opponent with cards like Dig Through Time and Den Protector. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Ugin and Garruk provides additional win conditions and card advantage, making it difficult for opponents to overcome the deck's strategic advantage.

The deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Languish and End Hostilities. It aims to apply pressure with efficient threats like Siege Rhino and Den Protector, backed up by versatile cards like Abzan Charm. The deck also has a solid mid-to-late game plan with planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Garruk, Apex Predator. Overall, the deck looks to have a proactive game plan with a good mix of disruption, removal, and threats to close out the game quickly.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on a strong creature lineup backed up by versatile removal spells and disruption. It aims to apply pressure early with efficient threats like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, while also maintaining control with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Nissa, Vastwood Seer provide additional value and flexibility. The deck is rounded out with powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and a splash of board wipe with Languish. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue opponents in a midrange battle.

This deck focuses on aggressively boosting creatures with powerful heroic abilities, utilizing cards like Battlewise Hoplite, Favored Hoplite, and Hero of Iroas. By protecting these creatures with Gods Willing, Ajani's Presence, and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. The Ordeals provide additional benefits while triggering heroic effects, and Temur Battle Rage can deliver a lethal blow for a fast victory. The mana base allows for a consistent deployment of threats, ensuring a strong offense throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, Rattleclaw Mystic, and Elvish Mystic in order to cast powerful threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Polukranos, World Eater. The deck also utilizes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Whisperwood Elemental to control the board and generate card advantage. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures while maintaining a strong board presence and mana advantage.

This deck focuses on using a combination of cheap and versatile spells along with aggressive creatures to quickly pressure your opponent. Using efficient creatures like Mantis Rider and Goblin Rabblemaster alongside burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash, you can put your opponent on the defensive while keeping control of the board. Cards like Dig Through Time and Ojutai's Command provide card advantage and flexibility, while cards like Valorous Stance and Harbinger of the Tides offer protection and disruption. Utilizing a mix of tempo and control, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board and deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Hordeling Outburst, Mantis Rider, and Goblin Rabblemaster allow for early threats to be played, while spells like Wild Slash, Stoke the Flames, and Lightning Strike provide direct damage. Valorous Stance and Ojutai's Command offer protection and additional utility. Dig Through Time helps to dig for key cards and maintain tempo. Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Soulfire Grand Master provide card advantage and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent plays.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing powerful creatures like Thunderbreak Regent, Stormbreath Dragon, and Dragonlord Kolaghan while also having versatile removal spells like Crackling Doom and Hero's Downfall to control the board. It includes burn spells like Wild Slash and Draconic Roar to close out games quickly. The deck also has lifelink and card advantage engines with Soulfire Grand Master and Outpost Siege to sustain the pressure on opponents. Overall, the deck aims to outpace opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and removal spells to dominate the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The deck aims to stall the opponent's board presence with cards like Languish and Crux of Fate while also disrupting their plans with counterspells like Clash of Wills and Dissolve. It also utilizes card draw spells like Artificer's Epiphany and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes Thopter Spy Network and Hangarback Walker to generate additional threats and blockers.
